value.title: Planning Azure for SAP workloads
value.excerpt: As an IT Professional experienced in SAP solutions, you need to learn about how to leverage Azure resources that include virtual machines, virtual networks, storage accounts, and Azure AD. These modules will give you the Azure knowledge around the reference architecture for SAP Workloads, how to plan for the implementation of SAP solutions on Azure, and the preparation for your migration of SAP workloads to Azure.

topItems.title: Utilize Azure for SAP workloads reference architecture
topItems.excerpt: Utilize Azure for SAP Workloads Reference Architecture

topItems.title: Planning for implementing SAP solutions on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Planning for implementing SAP solutions on Azure

topItems.title: Prepare to migrate SAP workloads to Azure
topItems.excerpt: This module provides details on the important steps prior to deploying SAP workloads to Azure: project preparation and planning, pilot, non-production, production preparation, go live, and post production.

value.title: Authenticate apps to Azure services by using service principals and managed identities for Azure resources
value.excerpt: Securely authenticate apps to Azure to manage and access Azure services. Service principals and managed identities give your app an Azure AD identity.

value.title: Deploy and configure servers, instances, and databases for Azure SQL
value.excerpt: Deploy and configure servers, instances, and databases for Azure SQL

value.title: Edit code through branching and merging in Git
value.excerpt: Level up your Git knowledge by learning about how to keep code separate using branches and how to merge them later

value.title: Track wild polar bears with AI
value.excerpt: Detect and track polar bears through photos using AI, then use Power BI to show where polar bears are being spotted.

value.title: Provision and manage cloud services
value.excerpt: Cloud Admin course from Dr. Majd Sakr at Carnegie Mellon University. Learn about the different types of resources available on the cloud and the technology behind how they work.

value.title: Create a new Node.js project and work with dependencies
value.excerpt: Create a Node.js project and learn to add packages and manage package dependencies in your project.

value.title: Identify anomalies by routing data via IoT Hub to a built-in ML model in Azure Stream Analytics
value.excerpt: Learn about Azure IoT Hub message routing, and Stream Analytics anomaly detection. Start by creating an app that simulates issues with conveyor belt vibration. Then, use the Azure portal to route all the data for archiving in blob storage. Finish by routing the vibration data to anomaly detection, using a built-in ML model.

value.title: Explain machine learning models with Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: Many decisions made by organizations and automated systems today are based on predictions made by machine learning models. It's increasingly important to be able to understand the factors that influence the predictions models make.

value.title: Explore provisioning and deploying non-relational data services in Azure
value.excerpt: Explore provisioning and deploying non-relational data services in Azure

value.title: Expose hybrid services securely with Azure Relay
value.excerpt: Securely expose services that run in your on-premises network to clients in the cloud, without having to open a port on your firewall or make intrusive changes to your corporate network infrastructure.

value.title: Discuss Azure fundamental concepts
value.excerpt: Learn about the different types and categories of cloud computing.

value.title: Getting Started with Microsoft Identity
value.excerpt: Learn the basics of Microsoft identity including the different types of tokens, account types, and supported topologies.

value.title: Introduction to Python using the datascience library
value.excerpt: Learn about Python expressions, functions, basic data types(numbers, strings), and comparisons

value.title: Migrate on-premises workloads to Azure
value.excerpt: Migrate on-premises workloads to Azure

value.title: Monitor models with Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: After a machine learning model has been deployed into production, it's important to understand how it is being used by capturing and viewing telemetry.

value.title: Planning for implementing SAP solutions on Azure
value.excerpt: Planning for implementing SAP solutions on Azure

value.title: Prepare on-premises workloads for migration to Azure
value.excerpt: Prepare on-premises workloads for migration to Azure

value.title: Prepare to migrate SAP workloads to Azure
value.excerpt: This module provides details on the important steps prior to deploying SAP workloads to Azure: project preparation and planning, pilot, non-production, production preparation, go live, and post production.

value.title: Read and write data in Azure Databricks
value.excerpt: Read and write data in Azure Databricks

value.title: Recommend and design system feedback mechanisms
value.excerpt: Learn how surveys and application analytics create a feedback loop that helps you understand the voice of the customer.

value.title: Remotely monitor and control devices with Azure IoT Hub
value.excerpt: Create an IoT Hub device app, and a back-end service app. As a scenario, we use the monitoring, and controlling, of the temperature and humidity of a cheese cave.

value.title: Identify governing practices for responsible AI in government
value.excerpt: Learn guiding principles for governments, and how to choose and operationalize a governance system to responsibly and successfully use AI in the public sector.

value.title: Approach your data-flow diagram with the right threat model focus
value.excerpt: Threat modeling is an effective technique to help you identify threats and ways to reduce or eliminate risk. We start by deciding to focus on either what needs to be protected or who it needs protection from.

value.title: Create a threat model using data-flow diagram elements
value.excerpt: Data-flow diagrams are graphical representations of your system and should specify each element, their interactions and context.

value.title: Tune hyperparameters with Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: Choosing optimal hyperparameter values for model training can be difficult, and usually involved a great deal of trial and error. With Azure Machine Learning, you can leverage cloud-scale experiments to tune hyperparameters.

value.title: Go serverless: Event-driven applications with Azure Functions | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Jeff Hollan joins Scott Hanselman to show how you can quickly develop and deploy code to run in the cloud with Azure Functions. Functions can be written in a variety of languages, and will automatically trigger and scale based on your application needs.  1:53 - Demo  Quickstart: Create your first function

value.title: How to create, share, and use Azure Portal dashboards | Azure Portal Series
value.excerpt: In this video of the Azure Portal "How To" series, learn how to easily create, share, and use dashboards in the Azure Portal.    Try out these features in the Azure portal: https://ms.portal.azure.com/#home   Keep connected on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AzurePortal   And make sure to keep an eye on

value.title: Analyze the sentiment of reviews with Keras
value.excerpt: Keras is a high-level neural networks API, written in Python, that runs on top of other deep learning tools such as TensorFlow. This module uses Keras to build a neural network that scores text, such as user reviews for sentiment.

images.title: Analyze the sentiment of reviews with Keras

value.title: Automate IoT devices management with Azure IoT Hub
value.excerpt: Automate IoT devices management with Azure IoT Hub
